name: The Westin New York at Times Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a King room at the Atrium Club within the Westin hotel: Atrium Club rooms are lower floor rooms which have recently been remodeled and updated to a modern decor and they feature a club lounge which serves continental breakfast (bagels, cereal, juice, coffee, etc.) and cocktails in the evening and has free beverages (water, soda, etc.)
reviews.title: Atrium Club: newer, clean, quiet, a decent stay

reviews.text: The rooms have very small windows without much view of interest but the room itself is spacious for NY standards and the decor is a light blue which makes it feel lighter and brighter than it otherwise would. Internet access is free and there's a Mac in the room for your use, which was nice.
reviews.title: Great Room... not so sure about the concierge...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms were short on counter space and the shower also felt small because the shower heads are so big and there's a rack for towels inside the shower. But everything felt new and clean and well organized.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Times Square is not my favorite part of Manhattan to stay in given the touristy glitz and crowded sidewalks, but it's convenient enough and the rates were much lower than in other parts of town for comparable rooms. I think this hotel is a decent option if you get a good rate (we booked ours on the Starwood website and got a 30% off prepaid rate).
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location
The hotel and staff are great
reviews.text: My only concern was that hotel security seemed a bit loose - we could come and go as we pleased and get all the way to our room without a keycard - I think that rooms at a Times Square hotel should have keycard access in the elevator to protect guests and their posessions.

Our family of six stayed here for a long weekend in November. It was in just the right location with it's easy access to Times Square. Teenagers (15 and 16) felt like they were in the most exciting place on earth. The 10 and 11 year old agreed. Therefore, that made it work for the parents.
reviews.title: Family Weekend in NYC
Great for a New York week
reviews.text: Our 6- persons situation requires two rooms which we booked with Starwood points and upgraded to the club level. We booked two rooms each with 2 doubles on the Club floor. One of the rooms had a couch and a couple of chairs plus large windows. The rooms did not connect but we felt safe with the setup.
Before we got there I thought this was one of the hotels right in Times Square. It is not, but it is 1 block off which was just fine with us.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: We were there to see shows on Broadway and to visit with family on the upper west side. Theatre's are nearby and for restaurants we enjoyed Tony's DeNapoli on W. 43rd between 6th/7th. Also, Angus McIndoe on W. 44th between 8th/Broadway. Both very good quality and family-friendly.
reviews.title: Favorite Hotel
Cold. Sterile. Depressing.
reviews.text: It's an enormous hotel but it worked really well for our family. We weren't there to spend a lot of time in the hotel room but we were seeking a high quality hotel in a central location. We walked or took taxis everywhere. The service was fine but we had pretty low expectations because we knew it was a huge hotel. We would definitely return with our family and stay again on the Club floor to take advantage of the muffins, coffee/tea/juice, fruit in the morning and snacks and desserts at other times.

The wife and I booked this hotel for the second time due to the fact we stayed here a few years ago and enjoyed it here. Location was a big plus for us and rooms were good. Arrived on dec 3rd long travel time almost 13 hours so were quite tired when arriving at the hotel . When we arrived at the check in desk the girl on duty asked us for Our name and identification. She then spent a few minutes on the computer and handed me the room key. Here's what annoyed me she never welcomed us to the hotel . Was this our first time here?? Because if she did not know she forgot to inform us any info about the hotel or services. When I asked if the breakfast and wifi were included she told me no that expedia bookings do not include this. I informed her that it was included in my booking . She asked me had I a booking ref and I gave it to her . And then just walked off to an office I presume to check as she did not say anything to us then returned minutes later to say there was no breakfast or wifi included on this booking. I told her there must be a mistake and she said unless I had documentation to say different she could do nothing. I asked her if there was wifi at the desk so I could retrieve my booking from my phone. I was un able to so I just took the key and said I was tired and would come back later . Sadly we ended back downstairs again because we were not told where the lift to the room was! When we got to the room We were shell shocked. First the room was smaller than before even though we booked a deluxe king room. The air con was banging away very noisy. The door on the bathroom was hanging off and the bathroom itself was in poor condition. The room was in need of a revamp.we decided we could not spend a week in this room so I made a call to hotels.com to check my booking and they told me breakfast and wifi are included in my booking and he would ring the hotel straight away to clear this up. We went back down to the check in and a new lady was on the desk. Oh boy I though the worst was over but how wrong was I. The lady at the desk Janice was her name not that she introduced herself but I took note of it later on. I explained to her that the room was not satisfactory . Room was small noisy and bathroom a poor standard. She said nothing and looked up the computer. Said to me minutes later the room had a walk in shower?? I said the room was not up to standard as we had stayed here before and the room was far better than this. She turned away and walked into an office in the back said absolutely nothing to us . Five minutes later she returned worked on the computer for a few minutes and turned away and walked back to the office. She still had not spoken to us. Minutes later she returned and worked on the computer . Another cane from the office and worked on another computer beside her and five more minutes later she handed us keys to a new room. So far this has tale 15 mins approx and the only words spoken to us was the fact the room had a walk in shower! I asked her was the breakfast and wifi included with this room as the booking company rang during the process to confirm they spoke to the hotel. Without even checking she said it was not as expedia do not include breakfast and wifi in their bookings! I informed her that the booking company rang to confirm they spoke to the hotel when she disappeared to the office. Again without a word she turned and yes again went back to the office. Five more minutes later she returned spent five more minutes later writing and handed me five vouchers. I then asked was my wifi included and she told me it was . I then had to ask if I needed some sort of password to access the wifi and she told me what I had to do to access it. We went to our room. We have travelled the world over the past 15 years and we have stayed in the best and not so good hotels in our time. This has to be the inhospitable reception we had seen actually just outright rude and bad mannered. No excuse can be accepted here as both receptions were bad.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: It took a day or 2 to put this behind us and enjoy our holiday. We decided not to complain to a manager the treatment we received and chose to instead avoid contact with these people and enjoy our holiday. I have never wrote a review of a trip away before but I was compelled to write this. Doing so I am getting very angry and upset with the treatment we were given on arrival. Not once did they apologise for anything making us fell small and stupid all the time. Shame on you westin hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed there with my mum and my aunt and we had separate rooms which were of a good size and were comfortable. Reception was not at all helpful and did not take much notice of any requests we had. But the main reason why I have decided to write this review was on the saturday night we deciced to have dinner at the hotel restaurant-it was quite late but they said that as we were staying at the hotel we could have dinner. I had invited my aunt who lives in New York to have dinner with us and I had the steak which was good, but my two aunts shared the lamb. We had other side dishes including brocolli which were cold and quite disguting. We belive the lamb was off as that night my two aunts were sick and constantly throwing up. We feel they both had food poisoning. When we discussed this matter with the hotel manager -they first argued that this was not the case even though they refunded the food and sent up us fruit etc. BUT A FEW MONTHS LATER THE HOTEL RECHARGED MY AUNTS CREDIT CARD WITHOUT TELLING HER OR GIVING HER ANY EXPLANATION OF AN AMOUNT 0VER $300. So if you wish to stay at this hotel then do not eat at the steak restaurant in the evening. I am completely disgusted and shocked that such a hotel can act in this manner.
reviews.title: Don't eat at the restaurant -you have been warned !!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights. The location is ideal for exploring New York - the subway is directly opposite. The staff were very friendly and helpful (porters, reception and conceirge service) We had room 2042 on 20th floor. It was roomy, the bed was comfortable and had all the amenities that we wanted. The shower worked fine but was nothing out of the ordinary. The view was excellent and every morning I spent a couple of minutes watching the world below. The room was clean and linen changed daily. The only downside to this hotel is that it is so big that it is quite impersonal.If we hadn't needed the excellent advice of the staff on a daily basis , no one would have spoken to us for the whole of our stay - the reception area is vast. Whilst there was a coffee making machine in our room, tea had to be bought from Starbucks on the ground floor - a bit of a trek in the morning! The hotel breakfast is expensive so we went to the Westway Diner on 9th Ave between west 43rd and 44th, excellent value. We also ate at 5 Napkin Burger 630 9th Ave; Hells Kitchen 679 9th Ave bet 46 and 47 sts and Amys bread shop opposite. I would recommend them all. We also ate at the Oyster Bar in Grand Central Terminal - the fish is superb!!

reviews.text: We stayed at this Westin just before New Years Eve. While it's well located, I'd say it's overrated. We have stayed at many different Westin Hotels and we've never been charged to use the gym which were were at this Westin. And we had NO hot water for showers following our workouts. When we called down to inquire about the hot water they said they were working on it and that we could have until 12:30 to check out (As an extension of the standard time which is 12 noon!). I asked at that point to speak to a manger who was more able to work with us regarding the hot water issue and the gym charges. It was a shame to have to spend anytime, while we were in NYC so briefly, dealing with these issues. The rooms are nicely appointed, clean and we had a nice view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed here 25--29 March 2011, At the end our speedy check in we were told that we had been given an upgrade to a 45th top floor room and upon opening our door we were taken aback by the NY skyline view from our window. Room was well equipped and very comfotable, nice bathroom, Internet access, large flat screen, mini bar, iron + board, TV etc. Staff and porters very pleasant and helpful. The real gem is the fabulous location barely 120m from Times Square and just along from the Hard Rock Cafe. Broadway shows were all within a short walk as was everything. Cabs were readilly available from Hotel door to take you anywhere further and very reasonable. Grand Central, Maceys, Central Park, Empire State, Chrysler Bldg. all within walking distance. Bar 10 and Shulas Restaurant in Hotel were OK though we only had breakfast once there. You really should try Grand Central Stationeateries for breakfast , the cosmopolitan array of different eating styles is really an experience, sharp suited business people alongside tourists and street living folk, what contrast. We have stayed at the Soffitel (very plush) and the New Yorker (A bit basic but good value) but for location comfort and value the Westin is a tough act to beat.

Traveling with the family and I'm determined to get a workout in every day we're here - there's plenty of walking in NYC but there's also plenty of good eating/drinking and I don't want to return home up 10 pounds. The hotel was picked, in part, based on what looked like a decent hotel gym - they even have special rooms with a spa/fitness emphasis (maybe good for non-family trips).

reviews.text: Okay truth is i could never afford a room here but we won a 1day stay in a charity raffle for $250 the room was listed as $1500/night. We were set up in a Executive suite with all the amenities. Our room had 2 queen beds each with $2500 bedding ( the bed is really firm though), a apple computer ,a large flat screen TV, a slate stone bathroom with 2 shower heads, and a view of Time Square. The downsides are parking is 1block down the street and is only up to 24hr parking, it was cold outside we could feel the wind break thru the windows and here all noise of Timesquare, they charge you to use the excercise room and extra for internet access incl WIFI.

Memorable memorial weekend with kids, Westin Times Square
reviews.text: The hotel is located in one of the busiest sections of the city on the corner of 43rd and 8th Avenue. The check-in was easy (up the escalator) and it took about 5 minutes. We got an upgrade to 45th floor with a view of the Hudson & NJ. We reserved a double since we had 2 kids with us. The room was clean and comfortable. It had a flat screen TV, but since we weren't there for business we didn't look for an internet connection. The room was a good size for NYC and was big enough for the 4 of us. It had the heavenly beds indicative of a Westin. The bathroom was larger than I expected for NYC. It was modernly decorated with a large bathtub, pocket door and double shower heads. The water pressure was a bit weak, but the bathroom was CLEAN, no mold on the shower curtain, bathtub, tiles or sink and no stray hair. My only complaint is that the toilet flushes really, really loud. We didn't use the room service or the restaurants in the hotel. There is a Starbucks (on 44th) and cafe Europa next door for coffee in the morning. No need to pay $8 for a cup of coffee or $4 for bagel.

There's some construction nearby but since we were on the 45th floor we weren't bothered by the noise. I was awakened by some drunk men getting off the elevator the first night but we got them back since our kids wake up at 6am and watch cartoons. When we checked out we were charged for 6 cans of beer. I had moved them around since I wanted the room for milk in the fridge for the kids. They removed the charges and told me that the hotel offers complementary fridges and that the minibar has sensors. When the drinks are moved it's automatically charged. They were pleasant and without attitude.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place to Stay in New York City!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location. There are lots of restaurants and grocery stores one block away on 9th ave. and is in walking distance to central park (about a mile, 15 blocks). The area has changed alot since I lived there 13 years ago and Times square is alot safer and gentrified. No more hookers or x-rated shops. We felt very safe walking around even with small kids. One note skip the Waybest Diner on 9th avenue its the way worst diner we've been to but try Nick's between 50th & 51st on 9th Ave. its the best Greek restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend took me to New York for my 30th and we chose this hotel as it was not too pricey but not too cheap and seemed a good location, as it was our first time in NYC for both of us. We were impressed with the Westin, just round the corner from times square the location is excellent. We walked all around despite being cold in February, we walked to 5th Avenue, Central Park, Macy's, Empire State, Rockafella, Library, Grand Central Station, we even walked down to Grenwich village! with a few stops on the way. After tiring days sightseeing and lots of walking we were so happy to have a clean room and comfy bed! and oh i forgot the amazing view from the window! I was so excited by the view and to be in New york i couldn't wait to get up each morning and look out the window! i took a lot of photos of the view! and around New York. We weren't in the hotel too much just to sleep and rest so it was a perfect base. Would highly recommend especially for first time visitors. It even snowed on my birthday which was very romantic! When we arrived we were told we were upgraded to a spa room, which was on a higher floor (amazing view) and had a lovely massage chair- very nice to ease aching limbs, and a fancy bathroom- lovely! Also with our package from Virgin holidays we had $20 a day to spend in the hotel, so when in New York we had a cocktail in the bar before dinner, nice touch. All in all a magical trip to New york, thanks partly to a fab hotel and location. Hope to go again, maybe 40th!!?!

reviews.text: I had been here once before for a quick work trip so I knew I liked the location. I wanted a room with a view for the weekend trip with my 8 year old; this will likely be his only NYC trip this year.and we wanted to do the holiday stuff. I booked a premium deluxe room at $400 plus, primarily to ensure a room on a high floor with a view. This hotel must improve its reception staff and procedures. Last time, it was bad -- no welcome at all. This time, arriving at noon, I waited in line for 20 minutes, only two people were working check in (aside from the separate Starwood gold line.) The man who checked me in told me "It's always like this on saturday." If so, why not put an extra person on? A manager looked on in a disinterested way but did not jump in and help. I travel a lot and this level of disinterest in the very first guest impression of the hotel is surprising. When I politely asked what floor we were on, he said he'd put me in a large room on the 11th floor, (a preferred guest floor) and that he "didn't advise" waiting for a room on a higher floor, which I'd have to check back on later in the day. i took his advice; I did not want to spend another long time in line. The room on the 11th floor was nice, ok amount of space by NY standards, and had an interesting (but low) view for my son down the cross street. The bathroom was superior to the room last time.
reviews.title: second visit -- family weekend trip

They knew we were celebrating our birthdays and the room was decorated with balloons and birthday signs-really creative way of using garland to spell out "50" on the bed. The staff from check in to check out were so attentive and friendly. Our room was more spacious than the room I had stayed in once before so we decided upon checkin to order room service and hang out until going out that night. Yummy chicken Soup and vegetable wrap was so delicious and was delivered to our room within minutes. That night I had ordered room service for the morning to be delivered at 9am but called at 8am to see if it could be delivered earlier. While waiting for them to call me back the breakfast was devlivered within minutes! Our room was on the 11th floor with what they called a not so great view (we have stayed in a room before with a view of the river) but we were able to see the hustle and bustle of the city below, not a brick wall.

reviews.text: We recently returned from a combination work/pleasure week at the Westin. It's always fun to be in New York when it's decked out in full holiday splendor anyway, but staying in the middle of the action in a wonderful lodging made it even more special. For the business side of the week, the conference facilities and staff at the Westin were professional, and attentive. Of course, that was why we "had" to be there. Why we wanted to be there was for all of the adventures awaiting us in the Times Square area. Within easy walking distance from the Westin are more theaters, restaurants, parks, and shopping than we could visit in a year! We particularly enjoyed staying in such a central location because it allowed us to easily stop by the hotel to drop off the results of my wife's shopping, grab a quick shower, take a nap, or change into evening attire without a hassle. We were always within a short walk back to the hotel. Once at the hotel, the room we had was on a Starwood Preferred floor, 44th to be exact. The views around the city from our spacious King room were impressive. The other thing we noticed was how quiet it was in the room. Usually, in previous visits to the city at other properties, the noise level was much higher. I think being on one of the higher floors, in an upgraded room, made a worthwhile difference. When you're in the Times Square area, there is activity 24x7. Being able to come back and get your sleep to recharge for another day of shopping, shows, eating, drinking, and walking is pretty key! We travelled to NYC by Amtrak, and Penn Station is only a few blocks away. There's a subway and bus station on the street next to the hotel, it couldn't be more convenient. We'd be happy to go back to stay at the Westin if we had business in that area, or just needed a fun escape.

reviews.text: I stayed one Saturday night at Westin Times Square with my sister and mom for my sister's 30th birthday. I chose this hotel because the Hilton was not available, and we needed to stay somewhere close to both Port Authority terminal and the Schoenfeld theatre for our show that evening. We arrived prior to noon and our room was not available. We left our bags with the bellman, left the hotel, and returned after 3:00pm, the hotel's check-in time. There was somewhat of a delay in getting our room, with the front desk clerk needing to check with a supervisor, but ultimately we were given a room with 2 double beds on a high floor overlooking 8th avenue, as I had requested in my initial reservation (I am a Starwood Preferred Guest member). The room was not as small as I had expected. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo, small sink and commode, closed with a frosted pocket door. The closet contained the coffee maker, fridge and safe. The two double beds had a single nightstand between, but there was room for a desk, chair and lounge chair as well. Flat screen TV. I love the Westin's heavenly bed, and we were able to get a good night's rest. Street noise was minimal despite being on the Port Authority side of the building. We were high enough up to overlook the river and New Jersey. It was peaceful to look out over the city on Sunday morning. The window in the room actually opened for those of you who like fresh, city air. Overall the room was neat and clean. On par with Westin standards.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Westin for a business trip in March. Chose the Westin due to its proximity to the NASDAQ Marketsite facility. Had a very pleasant stay from beginning to end. Check in was the only part of the experience that was not smooth. I reserved a block of rooms ahead of time for my colleagues and also paid a deposit on them. We reserved King rooms for everyone. At check-in we were told there were no Kings available, which just didn't sound right. After approximately a 10 minute delay, we received our King rooms. To my surprise, I received one of the Westin's Workout rooms, which was an absolute treat because I needed to do my workout on the road. Room came equipped with a treadmill, weights, a ball, a mat, and a DVD player which I got a lot of use out of because I brought my fitness DVDs with me. The standard rooms do not have a DVD player. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a bit tiny and had limited counter space which is probably only an issue for women who want to spread their toiletries out, like me. Unfortunately my mini fridge was not cold so I had warm water upon check-in. I requested a mini fridge to be brough to my room because I eat a very special diet and needed to refrigerate my food. The fridge was promptly brought to my room. It was a little scuzzy but I'm low maintenace, so it wasn't an issue. Overall, great experience and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Prime Location

reviews.text: I stayed at the westin for a business conference (also held within the hotel complex) on May 23-25. On the morning of May 24, I left my room at 745 am to attend my meetings on the 5th floor. I went up to my room during the10am morning break since I forgot my notes. When I entered my room, I noticed that my ipod, kindle and personal blackberry, which I left on the bedside table to recharge were gone. The devices were gone; but the idiot thief left behind the chargers! I immediately called hotel security. Someone came up 10 minutes later to take down my report. That was the only action taken, since apparently, they had to wait for the security manager, who was offsite, to return after 2pm . In the interim, there was no action taken. Hotel securtiy did not interview the staff nor conduct a physical check. The security manager finally got back to me after 4pm that day to inform me that they will be reviewing the door security logs. After several phone calls and discussions, they told us (who had arranged the trip) that they had no record of anyone entering my room and will not compensate me for my loss. At some pointy, one of the staff even insinuated that I made this up. IF THE WESTIN HOTEL HAD NO RECORD OF UNAUTHORIZED ENTRY IN MY ROOM, THEN THEY HAVE A HUGE PHYSICAL SECURITY GAP! THEY NEED TO HAVE BETTER PROTOCOLS THAN MERELY TAKING DOWN AN INCIDENT REPORT AND REVIEWING THE ENTRY LOGS!
reviews.title: DON'T STAY HERE! POOR RESPONSE TO IN-ROOM THEFT! Ipod, Kindle & Blackberry were stolen from my room.

reviews.text: In the mean time, I have no way of recovering my kindle, ipod, blackberry and the content and contacts. All I could do was report the loss of the devices to amazon, apple, and my telephone service provider so that they could prevent any future transaction from those devices.

reviews.text: We drove to New York, staying just outside of the city in Fairfield, NJ, so we could get into Manhattan early Saturday and start sightseeing. Our room was not available, but the desk agent put a hold on our double, so we checked our bags and car and set of.

reviews.title: Request Corner rooms!
reviews.text: When we returned at about 4 p.m., we were able to check in quickly. We were booked into a handicapped accessible room and forgot to change it at check-in. Good move: the extra wide walking area in rooms made it seem all the more spacious. No NYC claustrophobia here. The only bad thing about the room was the location: it was on 15th floor at the corner of 8th and 42nd with a spectacular view of the Port Authority terminal! The club level is located on the lower floors (10-16 I think), so I am not sure any of them has much of a view. The plus side of the club level is the complimentary continental breakfast and evening hors d'ouevres. Avoiding the typical $15 per person cost of breakfast was a great deal; and we combined a late lunch with the evening snacks to avoid a $150 pre-theater dinner. The down side (at least this particular weekend) was the crowds. There was a seemingly endless flood of people, which kept the staff struggling to keep up with the demand. Still, the food choices varied daily and if you were patient, you always got enough to eat.

reviews.title: Really nice place!
reviews.text: While the location of the hotel is very good, the entrance is on 8th Avenue, something I overlooked when booking. That puts you more toward the peep-show side of things, but still just a short walk to Times Square. We had the extra benefit of a major sideshow. While the kids were at a movie (at the conveniently adjoining Loews theater), half of the NYPD (at least 20 squad cars) ended up on 42nd St. just below our window. The best I could tell, they were chasing down guys selling counterfeit purses (I saw a load of them in the back of one squad car). It was quite a scene; if that kind of stuff makes you nervous, you should probably avoid NYC altogether, or at least Times Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I debated giving this hotel five stars, but settled for four. It's a very upscale business hotel located just off of Times Square (on 8th Ave. at 43nd St.). The service and rooms aren't quite up to 4 Seasons, but for the price and location, it's quite nice. Modern, well-furnished rooms, with widescreen LCD TVs. The bedside nightstand clock radio was actually an Ipod docking station. A very nice concierge lounge with free wireless. (Also free wireless in the lobby, but in the rooms, VPN-compatible internet access is $18 per day!). I did not ever eat in the hotel restaurant so cannot comment. The workout room is very well-furnished too. Bathrooms are kind of small, but hey -- it's New York. All rooms are small. There's a huge Starbucks on the back (42nd St.) side of the hotel, which is accessible without going outside.

Very modern, and we loved the white beds. Dual shower heads woke us up perfectly every morning. We enjoyed everything, but there are a few things I should mention. For those who like their privacy, there are no locks on the bathroom door, no fan, and the light in the bathroom shines very brightly into the shower. The bed was very comfortable, though, and all in all we had a FANTASTIC time here! Definitely will be back. I have never been in a hotel that is so fast, it makes your ears pop! So cool!

reviews.title: Extra charge for NS & fitness
reviews.text: Stayed here weekend of March 5. Had booked on Travelocity and requested NS room for health reasons. I even called the hotel directly during the week to emphasize request and was told "no problem." When we arrived at the hotel (early, I might add) we were told there would be no NS rooms available in "our category because we booked through a third party" but we could pay $30 more per room per night (plus all of the tax...) and get NS. So, that is what we had to do. I do not feel this was handled well. During my earlier phone call, I also asked if there was a fitness center and was told "yes", but no one told us it is $10 extra per person per visit. While the room was nice and facilities nice, I thought these extra fees were a ripoff and not in keeping with "great service" - if you want/need a NS room, beware!

reviews.title: Great stay!
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in January. Loved the bed, very comfy. The location is great, a lot of sights are walking distance, and the subways are very close. There's a Starbucks downstairs if you want a quick cheap breakfast too. The rates for in room internet access were quite high, but there was free wifi in the lobby, although that was advertised nowhere. The only drawback was being forced to watch CNN in the elevators.

reviews.title: Had a great stay!
reviews.text: Just got back from a trip to NY with another couple and loved the Westin! Great rooms with comfortable beds stacked with lots of down pillows, really fast elevators, good views, one room had a city view, one a river view. The food at Shula's was delicious, the location great, we walked to our show, Times Square, shopping...etc But the best part about staying at the Westin was the people who work there. From the front dest, to the concierge, to the bellman, we coudn't have asked for a more helpful, nicer group. They made our first stay wonderful and we will be back!

reviews.title: Heavenly Bed
reviews.text: Overall, the Westin was an above-average experience. Aside from the Heavenly Bed, which definitely changed my life, the entire hotel was quite nice, but not spectacular. By Manhattan standards, the Westin is a wonderful establishment, but the room still could have been more spacious. I requested a corner room after reading that it really improved stay due to the windows on all sides. It really made a difference and I would recommend that everyone get a corner room!

Overall, this was a very nice hotel and we are used to staying at very nice properties (Ritz, Four Seasons, etc). I'll break this down in sections for easy reference.
reviews.title: Great Short Stay at the Westin Times Square
Nice, but some issues as well
reviews.text: Location: The location of this hotel is terrific. Located between 44th and 43rd streets it is close to the shows and many attractions. We walked to the Garden and it took us only about 10-15 min. We were right across from Madame Tussaud's.

Check-in: We arrived about 4pm on a Thurs night. We waited only a few minutes and then the Valet took our car. It was $45 for valet parking and $25 for self park. We opted for the valet. It was cold and we were prepared for high prices, this is NYC. When we go away whether a long vacation or short over night, we budget for expenses. We were then sent up an escalator to the lobby. It is modern and sleek like the rest of the hotel. It's not the same Ritz gliz, but sleek and understated. Both are nice in their own right. There was no line and they took us right away. They had a little trouble finding my reservation, but since I had my confirmation printed out, they located it in short order. I had made a change from club room to corner deluxe upper floor that morning so things got a little mixed up (my fault). That brings us to the room.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.disliked: — The room was shabby and dirty.

reviews.text: Room: All I can say is WOW. When I explained to the desk clerk that I changed rooms because I heard (from this forum) that club level rooms were not on the highest floor and I wanted a good view, he said, "so you want a good view, I'll give you one." And what view he gave us. When he gave us the key and it said "4429", my husband said I looked so happy. I said "Wow, a "29" room. The 29 rooms are the rooms you want if you are looking for a view. We were on the 44th floor one side (3 windows) facing the Hudson River and Empire State Building, and the other the city and Times Square. This view was amazing. The room decor was sleek like the rest of the hotel. Done in black, grey and beige, with a splash of orange. The bathroom was not large, but well done with a stainless steel sink and black and white decor. We could even see the Hudson from the bathroom! There was a nice flat screen TV. The room was very clean.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Place in the Big Expensive City!

likes.liked: — Contemporary decor, trendy but not over the top

reviews.title: Perfect Location -- wonderful stay at the Westin
reviews.text: Restaurant: We ate both dinner and breakfast at Shula's. The steak was superb and the service top notch. I had a barbeque shrimp appetizer that was very nice. The creme brulee and cheesecake were both amazing. Large portions. Once again, expensive, but it's NYC and we budgeted for it.

A group of us stayed a week at the Westin New York at Times Square. The staff was friendly and helpful, service was prompt, everything was very clean, and the view from our corner suites was fantastic. (Loved the dual showerhead!) The location is perfect, close to Times Square and and walkable to theatres, bars and restaurants. The nearby subway system made travelling to other areas easy and convenient. Had a great dinner at their restaurant "Shula's" one night. All in all, we had a wonderful time and would highly recommend staying at the Westin at Times Square!

I will not normally choose a central location like Times Square in New York but I had to be walking distance to the Javits centre and needed two double beds in the room to share with a friend and Westin was the best looking of available hotels. It is indeed extremely central, pleasant, professional and friendly staff, good modern decor. The room I stayed was quiet, overlooking away from Times Square, roomy with 2 double beds and a nice enough bathroom. The iron and board was a plus. The toiletries were very mean, not even shower caps. The area is of course extremely busy and difficult to find taxi in the evenings to go out for dinner. I used their spa for a body treatment and it was OK, nothing special. But all in all for my purposes it was adequate and pleasant.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay/Immaculately clean
Fabulous!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved every moment. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade so had the benefit of a high room with superb views.

Booked this unit for $150 through Priceline. Great deal. Location is perfect. Got to the hotel at 5pm and the lady at reception checked us in and upgraded our room to one of the newly renovated ones on the 11th floor. Beautiful room, very modern decor. Huge floor to ceiling mirror on one of the walls. The dual shower head was great. The room is clean, came with a bottle of water, a couple of wine glasses, a couple of free Starbucks coffee packs and an in-room Mac computer. That's where all the good things ended. We asked for a crib for our 9 month daughter. The lady at reception called for one before we headed up. I expected to hear a knock on the door within 30 minutes of getting in the room. We settled down, spent about 1.5 hrs in the room before heading out for dinner and still no crib. However, when we got back the crib was there. When my daughter had a little accident on the crib, I called for an extra crib sheet. 30 min later, I had to call again and ask for it. They came about 15 minutes after the second call. I wonder what happened to the person they sent for the first call. Instead of sending a bed sheet, they sent a blanket. The guy that brought it up was nice and very polite. He even ran down to get us a sheet, so to thumbs up to him. The next day, after the room was serviced by housekeeping, the wine glasses were nowhere to be found. Instead they replaced them with disposable plastic cups. Plastic cups! Are you kidding me? So my wife called to ask for drinking glasses. They said it will be brought up but no one came. We did not bother calling again. Then on day three, they serviced our room and did not leave us fresh towels. I mean no bath towels at all. I just noticed after I got out of my bath. So I had to use the little dinky face towels to dry myself. They brought the towels up within 30 minutes this time around. What a disappointment.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but service not consistent with their brand.

reviews.text: Overall, the room was nice and well equipped. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The personnel was really nice except the service we got was really inconsistent with their brand. I expected more from a Westin. The plastic cups feel like a slap in the face, almost like we've upgraded you, you paid cheap because you booked through Priceline, so you don't deserve proper drinking glasses. I'd only recommend this place to a friend if you want a place at Times Square and you don't care much about service. Otherwise, stay at the W instead.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond!

reviews.text: I had an incredible stay! I was checked in by the most pleasant staff. Even though it was busy at the desk, the staff took the time to hold conversation and answer my questions. My room was clean, modern and had an amazing view. When leaving, I misplaced my business portfolio which the concierge staff immediately moved to help me locate, successfully! I was very impressed and will stay again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Would stay again!

reviews.text: This was a nice suprise in Manhattan... The hotel is truly up to Westin quality standards throughout (unlike other hotel chains in Manhattan). The smell of white tea when you arrive is quite calming. The room was much larger than I expected. Usually, I stay at the New York Hilton on the Hhonors Diamond Floor (most renovated) and I have to say that the room here on the regular floor was much nicer and larger. The Westin Heavenly Bed is the best (in my opinion) of any hotel chain and the Heavenly Bath Towels are awesome after a shower. The shower was okay, but water pressure was a bit low. The location is very good with lots of restaurants in walking distance. I generally prefer the central location of midtown, but this was an acceptable location and would be a gret location if you wanted to see shows. The bar area was nice, though busy, and service was good. The hotel has a Shulas Steakhouse in the lobby level which is consistantly good. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again!
reviews.title: Great service!

We had an overnight flight so arrived in the city at 7 AM. The front desk receptionist indicated that our room was not ready but recommended a great nearby cafe for breakfast. When we returned, our room was ready, and we were upgraded to a corner deluxe room. The view was amazing! The crib was brought up right away, and later during our stay, they also provided a high chair and a microwave. The location was perfect, close to everything, and we only took the subway to get to Brooklyn to visit friends.

The outlet in the bathroom is over the toilet, so you literally have to blow your hair dry over the toilet. Another problem - you get no cell phone reception in the hotel, so you have to use the hotel phone to make all of your calls and they charge several dollars for each call (I think about $5 per call with taxes, but can't recall for sure), so it adds up quickly. Also, no cell phone service means no blackberry service, so I had to log on to my computer (pay $15 for internet service) just to see if I had received e-mails. The bed was comfortable and we got a good night sleep even though you can hear noises from other rooms (people sneezing, flushing the toilet, etc., but no street noise). We went to the hotel's bar for a drink and got great service and good drinks. However, the hotel service is not so great - we called the front desk three times and asked for laundry bags, but they were never delivered.

We were in a junior suite, which was a huge room by NYC hotel standards. Great views from our giant windows (which also kept the room nice and bright) and the room was also very quiet. Did not hear a thing from neighbours so we had a sound nights sleep, plus being on the 44th floor meant great views of the city and no street noise. The air conditioning worked very well and one of the quietest systems I have experienced recently. The room was very modern with everything you could expect (bathroom had 2 types of shower gel, conditioner, body lotion, sewing kits, shower caps, vanity kit and mouthwash). There is a coffee machine that brews Starbucks in the room which is great but to make a simple cup of tea was a challenge and they never provided enough creamer also the room service was expensive (but to be expected) but they were our only negatives. You pay a lot for an average hotel in NYC but not a lot more to get a high standard one so I would definately recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent ages looking for a special hotel to celebrate our 30th Anniversary. It was also our first time to New York so we didnt have any knowledge of the area. We went at a very expensive time of year and so our expectations were probably high. On arriving at the Westin we were dissappointed that it really is predominantly a business hotel although the reviews we had read were really good. The room we had been appointed was nothing special, no bath although it did have very good views from the 38th floor. The following day I spoke to a lady at reception saying how disappointed we were that it was not a little more special for our anniversary and she said she would see if she could do anything although it was unlikely as they were so busy. Upon returning she had kindly managed to find us a corner room which is much better because you have more windows and the rooms are generally a lot bigger. The room was better and we had a bath and amazing views from the windows but it is definitely not really the sort of hotel for a romantic break. There are several other small chic hotels that we visited that I wish I'd have booked in hindsight which are very trendy and a lot more personable and no dearer. These are the 'W' hotels if I'm allowed to say it. But overall we had a great time and tried to make the best of it. We didnt use the hotel facilities at all, choosing to eat out. We had a wonderful cruise along the Hudson River at night and also a lovely meal at River Cafe just the other side of Brooklyn Bridge which was very special. Also the Boathouse restaurant in Central Park was pretty magical too. We did a food tour with Foods of New York around Greenwich Village which was really a great way to spend a few hours and was a highlight of our visit. It takes a while to know where you're going with all the shops, some are incredibly expensive but we really liked Maceys, huge with some really good deals.

I have never had one problem in the four years that I have gone there. The staff is always friendly and courteous. Concierge is always so helpful--giving advice about restaurants and which subway train to take. My three friends think they are in hog heaven when they go with me to the Westin. One of my friends says that I have spoiled her by taking her to the Westin Times Square. This place really knows how to treat you! We called the front desk just to ask for some clean towels. They sent housekeeping in immediately to completely clean our rooms. It was our fault that we left the sign on the door! But they are always so accomodating! I promise you that you won't be disappointed with this hotel---at least I never have. I love it so much that I'm taking my husband, two college-age kids, and two of their friends back after Christmas. I know they will love this hotel.

reviews.text: This isn't the Trump SoHo...I get that but this hotel needs to seriously revamp their service. Perhaps we made the mistake of staying during the weekend. It's a big hotel and they don't employ enough staff to handle their guests. Checking in at 2 PM was ridiculous. There was a long long line-up and only 1 attendant at guest services at prime check-in time on a FRIDAY! Although I'm a Starwoods preferred member, I skipped that line because it took longer! When we arrived, the hotel had decided to change our reservations. Luckily I had an email confirmation regarding the original rooms we had booked. TIP: Bring any reservations via email with you as you never know if they will try to give you something else. As a result of my presenting my original reservations we were upgraded to the corner rooms which were great in size. They are very very large for any hotel in any city. The amenities were poor. We had to constantly ask for towels and toiletries. You may need to call for the same thing a few times before you finally get a response. Even if you complain that your phone isn't working for incoming calls and they send someone to investigate, it still won't be taken care of. TIP: if you need to contact guest services, never dial '0' as you'll get charged for that connection! Even though there is a 'service' button on the telephone, they may not answer but don't dial '0'. It's just the way this hotel operates.
